alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Franklin; Union; Wayne (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 2:32PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF FRANKLIN COUNTY, SOUTHEASTERN WAYNE, UNION AND FAYETTE COUNTIES IN INDIANA, PREBLE AND WESTERN BUTLER COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN OHIO THROUGH 300 PM EDT... At 231 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 9 miles northeast of Lake Santee, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Richmond, Oxford, Connersville, Eaton, Batesville, Brookville, Centerville, Liberty, Camden, Lewisburg, New Paris, West Alexandria, West College Corner, Oldenburg, Glenwood, Darrtown, Lake Santee, Salem, Reily and Waterloo. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Indiana between mile markers 151 and 156. I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 16. I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 145 and 149. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM EDT for southeastern and east central Indiana...and southwestern and west central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
